search.title: Search engines
search.description:
Perhaps the most important thing a person needs in the modern world. 
Here, foreign search engines will be presented 
to make it easier to search in the foreign-language segment of the internet.

items.name: 1. Google Chrome
items.text:
I think there is no need to introduce 
the well-known Google Chrome. 
The link directs 
to the American Google.

items.name: 2. Yahoo
items.text:
Let's move on to the homeland 
of fromage and croissants. Yahoo - 
a French search engine. 
Although the French domain 
of Google exists, Yahoo is still 
more popular in 
France.

books.title: Downloading books
books.description:
Books are one of the main sources of information, but finding them
in free access is not so easy.

items.name: 1. Z-Library
items.text:
A huge library with foreign
literature.
You can find books in almost
any language. Download limit of 10 per day
for registered users.
There is a Telegram bot that allows
more downloads.
Access is possible via
Tor as well as mirrors.

items.name: 2. Flibusta
items.text:
A library of Russian literature.
Access is possible via Tor.

items.name: 3. Twirpx
items.text:
A library mainly with educational/
scientific literature.
Access via VPN.
To download, a symbolic donation
is required.

courses.title: Downloading courses
courses.description: Here are websites with leaked courses (and more).
courses.ps: P.S. I will add websites with tutorials I regularly use.

items.name: 1. Sharewood
items.text:
Sherwood â€“ a site with courses,
available after
registration and payment for
access (~500 rubles).
There is a Telegram channel with
short training
videos.
Access via VPN and
mirrors.

items.name: 2. RuTracker
items.text:
RuTracker. I mainly use it
for downloading movies in
the original or software,
but you can also find
courses there.
Access is only through 
VPN.

items.name: 3. YouTube
items.text:
Absolutely indispensable
thing.
There is always a sea of
information there.
The main thing is not to drown in
the waves of content :D

A site about chess.
There are lessons, but only one free per
week.
Recently, access is only via VPN.

The app is more popular than the site,
but the latter is also quite convenient.
It focuses on language learning.

forums.title: Forums
forums.description:
Here are links to discussion places. Sometimes you can come across a lot of interesting things 
while surfing forums.

items.name: Dreamhackers
items.text: About dreams and everything related to them

items.name: InFrance
items.text: About France

items.name: Cyberforum
items.text: For system administrators and programmers

items.name: StackOverflow
items.text: The English version of the forum for programmers

items.name: Help Math Planet
items.text: Discussion and solving math problems

items.name: SciTecLibrary
items.text: A scientific-technical forum about physics

items.name: Physics
items.text: English forum about physics

items.name: Mathematics
items.text: English forum about mathematics

items.name: Stackexchange
items.text: Contains links to various forums

chatgpt.title: ChatGPT
chatgpt.description:
I will separately highlight the well-known ChatGPT neural network. Very convenient 
if a quick answer to a question is needed, it saves you from the need 
for a long search and information systematization. It can also help in language learning, 
and in general in learning as a whole.
chatgpt.text: At the moment, access is only possible via VPN.

items.text:
To access some websites, it is necessary to use Tor.
You can download it from the link below.

Sometimes, you need to use VPN to access specific materials.
My personal choice is Planet VPN.
It can be installed as a browser extension or a mobile application.
